image.altText: A man adjusts his tie as he looks at a journalist who sits opposite him

props.synopsis: David Speirs says his leadership is secure despite the Liberal Party losing the Dunstan by-election to Labor. He will be counting on housing, tax reform and energy policies to help win back power at the next state election.

title.children: SA's opposition leader rejects he's on borrowed time despite Dunstan by-election loss

image.altText: a man with a dark beard wearing a polo shirt and puffer jacket looks into the camera

props.synopsis: Jean Nassif has left a trail of defect riddled apartment buildings in his wake, but in an exclusive interview with the ABC he says he's the number one builder on Earth and that he's been hunted out of Australia by powerful figures.

title.children: A yellow Lambo, gangs and a vendetta: The downfall of the 'number one builder on Earth'

image.altText: Photo illustration of Steve Jackson, Karen Webb, Bruce Lehrmann and Taylor Auerbach with dark background

props.synopsis: The Federal Court this week played host to allegations of cocaine benders, boozy dinners, $10,000 in sex worker and massage services charged to the Network Seven company card. The unexpected twist has its origins in a much smaller, Sydney political scandal.

title.children: How Taylor Swift faux pas sparked a chain of events that led to Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case being reopened

image.altText: Flooding at the Parramatta River caused river to overflow

props.synopsis: An overnight deluge dumps heavy rain across parts of Sydney and the Illawarra, prompting emergency evacuation warnings and rapid river rises.

title.children: Extreme weather warnings issued after heavy overnight rain falls across Sydney

image.altText: a woman behind a cafe bar

props.synopsis: It might be a labour of love, but passion isn't paying the bills for thousands of cafes and restaurants who are struggling to stay in business amid rising costs and falling demand.

title.children: 'We struggle to make a profit': Why your favourite cafe or restaurant might be the next casualty of high inflation

image.altText: A submarine moves through calm waters

props.synopsis: One US official said Japan could be interested in cooperating in a number of spheres, including advanced robotics, cyber initiatives and anti-submarine warfare.

title.children: Japan to take part in AUKUS 'Pillar 2' in first expansion of defence tech-sharing agreement

image.altText: Port Adelaide captain Connor Rozee roars in triumph as his teammate puts his hand out in acknowledgement after a goal.

props.synopsis: Connor Rozee, Jason Horne-Francis and Zak Butters are exceptional as Port Adelaide romped to a 69-point win over Essendon at Adelaide Oval, after Brisbane finally got their first win with a 70-point triumph over North Melbourne.

title.children: The best in the AFL? Power's midfield masterclass leaves Bombers shellshocked in Gather Round drubbing

image.altText: Police walk along a street at night in Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: South Australia Police will send 20 officers to Alice Springs following a request from the NT police commissioner to help continue "high-visibility policing" in the town.

title.children: South Australia to send officers to Alice Springs to assist with youth curfew, emergency response

image.altText: Two pictures of two separate men, both wearing suits outside court.

props.synopsis: Network Ten alleges the Seven Network paid Bruce Lehrmann hundreds of dollars for cocaine as "pre-production expenses" before he agreed to give an exclusive interview to a current affairs program.

title.children: 'Pre-production expenses': Invoice allegedly sent by Bruce Lehrmann for drugs, sex workers presented to court

image.altText: Seven Network's logo on a building

props.synopsis: Seven executives are dealing with escalating reputational damage that threatens the future of the Spotlight program, amid allegations made in court about payments from the network for drugs and sex workers in its efforts to secure an interview with Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's interview could bring down Spotlight and risks what remains of Seven's reputation

image.altText: Australian and Aboriginal flying flags side-by-side.

props.synopsis: A mother who requested her children be allowed to "sit silently" during the national anthem claims one was given detention by a private Christian school for refusing to stand.

title.children: Mother removes Aboriginal children from school following 'ultimatum' on standing for national anthem

image.altText: An older man with white hair wearing a suit with a blue tie gestures as he stands behind two microphones.

props.synopsis: Something snapped this week in the international community’s tolerance for Israel's repeated alleged breaches of the rules of war, let alone its tolerance of a tragedy that has seen tens of thousands of civilians killed since October 7.

title.children: The international community has been slow to confront Israel about its actions in Gaza. This week, something snapped

image.altText: People inspect the site where World Central Kitchen workers were killed by an Israeli drone strike

props.synopsis: The Israel Defense Forces says it dismissed two officers and reprimanded three others for their roles in drone strikes in Gaza that killed seven aid workers for World Central Kitchen on a food-delivery mission.

title.children: Israeli military dismisses two officers over deadly drone strikes on aid workers in Gaza

image.altText: A crimbled car, with several people looking at it, seen from a distance

props.synopsis: The Australian government writes to Israel saying it "hasn't yet satisfied" expectations of a thorough investigation into the deadly air strike that killed several aid workers including Australian woman Zomi Frankcom.

title.children: Australia to appoint 'special adviser' to examine Israeli air strike investigation

image.altText: A sign of a waste facility with an arrow pointing towards public trailer waste.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man who was murdered and found inside a wheelie bin at a rubbish dump has been described him as a 'kind' person who was 'full of empathy'. His sister confronted his killer through a victim impact statement in court.

title.children: Family of wheelie bin murder victim tells court they will never forgive killer's 'evil'

image.altText: Filipino Catholics with no shirt and hoodies on.

props.synopsis: Rockets in North Korea, cherry blossoms in Japan and heat waves in the Philippines — the Asia Pacific this week in photos.

title.children: Beyond doom and gloom: The Asia Pacific this week in 20 pictures

image.altText: A smiling teenage girl stands close to her grandfather in the open door of a light aircraft

props.synopsis: Teenager Alicia Hayes fell in love with flying at the age of seven after a flight with her grandfather. Now, she's prepping to be the youngest pilot at the Aldinga Airshow in South Australia this weekend.

title.children: 'We're like peas and carrots': Alicia and her grandfather share close bond over aviation

image.altText: A yoga instructor and participant.

props.synopsis: Yoga has long been thought of as a method for flexibility, but it also emphasises inclusivity, with participants pointing out that the practice can be noticeably different from the way it is sometimes portrayed on social media.

title.children: Chair yoga is helping people with neurological disorders, but what is it?

image.altText: A vehicle burning and emitting black smoke as trucks were banked up on a road among scrubland

props.synopsis: Three men are dead after a road train and a truck collided on the Eyre Highway, about 27 kilometres west of Yalata, on South Australia's west coast.

title.children: Three die in highway crash involving two trucks in South Australia

image.altText: Smoking chimneys behind fence

props.synopsis: Just 57 mega polluters are responsible for the bulk of the world's greenhouse gas emissions and most big fossil fuel players have increased, rather than decreased, their output since the Paris Agreement in 2015, a staggering new report finds.

title.children: A mere 57 mega polluters produce bulk of the world's greenhouse gas emissions, new analysis shows

image.altText: A woman wearing a pink top and white skirt stands in front of a bright pink wall, smiling

props.synopsis: From cancelled weddings to getting disowned by parents, these South Asian comedians are reclaiming their shame through Brown Women Comedy.

title.children: From cancelled weddings to being disowned — these South Asians are reclaiming their shame on stage

image.altText: a composite image of a healthy frangipanni flower and one attacked by mealybugs.

props.synopsis: Since its discovery last year, the papaya mealybug has spread across Darwin, impacting a range of host plants such as papaya, hibiscus and frangipanis.

title.children: Frangipani trees in Darwin 'hammered' by exotic pest. Can ladybirds stop it from spreading south?

image.altText: Milo the dog in a vet cage.

props.synopsis: Milo was about to board a flight to his new home in the UK before he escaped from a handler. After missing for almost three weeks, the Jack Russell Cross has finally been captured and will soon be reunited with his family.

title.children: Runaway pet dog who missed his flight to the UK found almost three weeks after disappearance

image.altText: A pug stands on a concrete sidewalk with his owner's feet in the background

props.synopsis: A pet might be registered in your name but possession is nine-tenths of the law, as 90-year-old Jenny Coman found out after she was struck by a car and had a friend care for her pug Max while she recuperated.

title.children: How far would you go to get your beloved pet back?

image.altText: A dark circle is ringed by bright white light in a dark sky.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the six men said they had reached a settlement with the state that would allow the men to view the solar eclipse "in accordance with their sincerely held religious beliefs".

title.children: Six inmates who sued New York over prison lockdown will get to view solar eclipse after all

image.altText: An elderly man in glasses sits in front of a blank wall.

props.synopsis: Ridsdale has been in prison since 1994 for the abuse of more than 70 children in Victoria. He was sentenced for the eighth time last year and is likely to die behind bars.

title.children: Notorious paedophile priest Gerald Ridsdale facing 62 new sexual abuse charges

image.altText: several men erecting a timber frame, behind them the bare hill can be seen

props.synopsis: A group of friends, dismayed about climate change, bought the most degraded piece of farmland they could find. Not to live on, or to make money from, but to transform into the bushland it once was.

title.children: They pooled their money to buy an 'ugly' hill. Twenty years later, they're calling it 'paradise'

image.altText: A crowd of people sitting on grass and a smaller group in a pool watching a performance on stage, forested hills in the b/g

props.synopsis: Tasmania's MONA FOMA event has been "killed" by its founder after 16 years, with the much-loved music and arts event joining the list of canned festivals.

title.children: MONA FOMA calls it quits, with founder admitting 'spell has worn off'

image.altText: Tom sits in the backseat of a car and looks up in concern, his hand near his face.

props.synopsis: Andrew Scott, Dakota Fanning and Johnny Flynn star in Academy-Award winning director Steve Zaillian's black and white adaptation of the classic Patricia Highsmith psychological thriller.

title.children: Andrew Scott is Tom Ripley in Netflix's arthouse take on the tale of murder and deceit. Does it hold up?

image.altText: A composite photo of the seven aid workers who died in the Israeli air strikes.

props.synopsis: The seven aid workers killed in Israeli air strikes on Monday are described as "the best of humanity", as their loss is felt around the world and sends another chill through humanitarian aid groups in Gaza.

title.children: 'The best of humanity': What we know about the seven aid workers killed in Israeli air strikes this week

image.altText: A middle-aged woman with glasses sits behind a desk with the nameplate "Israel".

props.synopsis: While non-binding, the resolution is bound to raise international pressure on Israel as a sign of widespread concern about its military campaign in Gaza.

title.children: UN human rights body calls for halt to weapons shipments to Israel as concerns about Gaza war mount

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

props.synopsis: The ACT Integrity Commission is assessing allegations about the conduct of Walter Sofronoff, who presided over the inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Conduct of head of inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution referred to ACT Integrity Commission

image.altText: A film still of Dev Patel, smiling up at a woman. He is lying in her lap, with other people seated around them.

props.synopsis: Dev Patel launches himself as a legitimate action star in his directorial debut with this violent revenge saga, steeped in Hindu legend.

title.children: Dev Patel goes for broke as a vicious underdog filled with righteous fury in his directorial debut
